website_summaries.verdict: Durable, absorbent, and versatile. Top quality socks by a trusted manufacturer of these handy, liquid-absorbing tools.
pros: Lightweight and easy to use to soak up all types of liquids
Features sturdy, mildew-resistant materials that easily adjusts to fit around corners, edges, and more
Each sock soaks up to a gallon of liquid
cons: Comes in choice of blue or yellow socks, and some consumers received the wrong color

customer_reviews.title: Not holding up the guts inside
customer_reviews.text: I am beyond disappointed with this product I purchased these on April 6, since then we have had small amount of rain but some, never expanded and now over half are splitting open and causing a bit of a mess, I have several ones that I patched with tape but I have had 3 that I had to dump in trash ans sweep up the stuffing. I really honestly dont see how I am the only one so far with this problem
customer_reviews.author: Lisandro E. Roque

customer_reviews.title: WOW !!!
customer_reviews.text: works fantastic!! when it rains water flows into our garage and we can have 6 or so inches of water in there about 10feet square area... the drains can't keep up. we put there out on a night of expected rain and they soaked it all up...nothing at all made it so far to get to the drains...
customer_reviews.author: Neva

customer_reviews.title: Looks Ugly & Does Nothing
customer_reviews.text: So I have 30 feet of standing planter beds I put in between my neighbors house and mine. The drip system I have on it made it so that they did leak water through, as intended, but the design of the cement had the water go towards my neighbor's house and walk way, which they did not appreciate. I placed this overlapping all along the walk way just past the planter legs. The hope was to redirect the water to my lawn and not to my neighbors house. Sadly, the water just went right under them, no redirecting of absorbed at all. For my purposes, complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again
customer_reviews.text: Not very happy with the quality as it has already ripped open and needs to be thrown out.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUY THESE
customer_reviews.text: This is not the same product sold two years ago. This is very flimsy material and the inside is not as good as before. The material breaks when it is handled even in the gentlest way.
customer_reviews.author: Little Eddie

customer_reviews.title: Did the trick
customer_reviews.text: Our basement was flooding and no end to the rain in site. We were on a schedule of removing water by hand and vacuum every 15 minutes. During one of my breaks I got on line and searched for ways to dam the water inexpensively still we could repair what ever was leaking. Got these on Prime. They arrived in 2 days. We put them down and they worked. We still needed to remove water, but this gave us the safety net we needed to save our possessions in the basement. Stagger the placement so that they aren't just end to end.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Yogi

customer_reviews.title: Keeping things under conrol
customer_reviews.text: Been having basement water issues. We had a routine figured out but after each time, we realized there was only a gallon or two of water we were cleaning up. Bought these and threw a few down where we normally deal with the issue and they have been amazing. Now we don't have to worry about putting down more towels, washing and drying them each time, etc. So much less stress knowing Pigs are working while we're asleep or at work. Got a box of them so I just rotate them out and let them out and leave them in the utility tub to drip dry.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Pace

customer_reviews.title: Does what it is supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: We live in an older mobile home and the windows tend to sweat in the winter time which makes the windows fog and sills mildew so I spend a lot of time cleaning it up. The Pig socks helped stop the fog and changing the Pigs every now and then have stopped the mildew. Great product! We bought several so we can switch them out and let the wet ones dry then reuse again.
customer_reviews.author: Emma Tator

customer_reviews.title: Has to be the Best
customer_reviews.text: We buy A LOT of product on Amazon, and we must say, this must be one of the best products. The quality, quantity and value can not be beat. We waited until it snowed to write this review. No more streams of water wandering around the garage from the vehicles. They stop the water from going places we don't want it too. The best is when we bring the snow laden snowmobiles inside the shop. Again, the water stays inside the area and not to the cabinets. They dry just fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Michele

customer_reviews.title: Good price. Best if just soaking up small leaks.
customer_reviews.text: It may be me, or my leak is just too much... But these only sucked up 1/2 of a gallon of water. I was hoping they'd hold at least double that. And the 2nd try (after hanging to dry for 48 hours), they barely got wet before the water just ran under them. Hoping it was just my application. I see these work well in stores. I think my leak was just too strong. Would still recommend for the price. I did not contact seller, as I really think it's just my issue and not that of the product.
customer_reviews.author: T. Smythe

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice product. We had our drains back up in the basement. Luckily I already had these in place. It did not absorb all the water, but it definitely absorbed at least a gallon, as promised. That was one less gallon that got into our carpet! I am now ordering more to put around the drains, in the “wet corner” of the basement, and around the water heater. The picture shows a “full” sock.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for wet basements
customer_reviews.text: The new pig socks worked even better than I expected. We have an intermittent leaky basement wall after heavy, prolonged rainstorms. The 48" length is a good size for our needs; I could arrange them around obstructions and leave them in place. The next time we had heavy rain (about a year later) the socks held most of the water; they made a tremendous difference compared to previous experiences. Each sock barely leaked at all as we picked them up to carry out of the basement. We placed them on the driveway to dry. I'm so glad I found this product, I was a little concerned about the cost but it was more than worth it.
customer_reviews.author: L. McLellan

customer_reviews.title: Sorry Pig...glad I didn't spend a lot.
customer_reviews.text: I was really happy with the speedy service. But I had a little water come in early this morning and oddly only half the sock took the water which made my situation back to square one. Now I have to buy yet another of a similar type of sock. SO instead of just draining the sock, I had drag out the wet vac and drain the sock.
customer_reviews.author: duwal

customer_reviews.title: Actually works
customer_reviews.text: I have a serious water issue in my basement when it rains heavy or a lot. I thought I’d try these. The water runs right under door down step like a waterfall. Can get up to an 1” or 2” across half the floor. These were amazing. Kept the Water by the door area. Dried them outside when it was nice and ready to reuse. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lesley

customer_reviews.title: A great solution to an occasional problem
customer_reviews.text: When it rains enough I get small leaks in the basement and garage. This New Pig stuff is the bomb. I can dry them out in the sun and re-use them several times. Even when they're old they still kind of work. I really don't throw them out until the stuff inside collapses. That doesn't happen the first few times I find. YMMV. The way I knew about them was, building managers at work gave out a few when we were having leaks at windows. They fixed the windows and later I had some left over. When I used those up I became a loyal customer.
customer_reviews.author: Max Oldham

customer_reviews.title: These ones do not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought more of these to replace ones that had been lost around our facility, for some reasons these do not seem to be working any where near the capacity of the original ones that we had. I am not sure if they re engineered the product or if somehow I got some knock off fakes. Not happy and I wouldn't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Abbott

customer_reviews.title: Probably not big enough for my needs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product as I have a screened in porch where rain water runs into from a patio on the same level hoping it would prevent the water coming in. It does prevent some of the water. I’m not sure if the product doesn’t absorb enough or I bought undersized. I’ve used these type products in commercial settings and found them to work fairly well. The second issue is the pig takes forever to dry out-days. So, I would say these would probably work for a light leak but not to prevent a larger pooling of water such as I have.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cotter

customer_reviews.title: What water?
customer_reviews.text: My MIL has had problems with wind driven rain leaking into her hatchway. I bought these for her & they work great!!! When we went down to check she said "Gee no rain must have come in." I walked over & lifted on & it had trapped all of the water that would have covered the floor. We were both impressed at how good a job they did. Put two out to dry & replaced them with the two dry ones. Even wet they are manageable for an elderly women ( she wanted to see how much water was in them). Bought them for my house too!!
customer_reviews.author: Christine Nathan

customer_reviews.title: In our rental we have the entire basement rimmed in these because we cleaned it so nicely that the renters wanted to use it for a ...
customer_reviews.text: These things have saved us a lot of trouble in our old houses. We have a rental, and our house that both have basement wetness problems, mostly due to the neighbors abandoning the storm drain systems and going with downspouts that just dump onto the yard. These do not mold, which means they can be left in place for longer. I still replace them every month or so in the Spring and Summer. In our rental we have the entire basement rimmed in these because we cleaned it so nicely that the renters wanted to use it for a TV room, with a big-screen. lol
customer_reviews.author: Planet West

customer_reviews.title: Effective and absorbing
customer_reviews.text: These were just what I was looking for to control a leaky water heater. Water heater was still operational but was leaking after almost 20 years of use. They absorbed the water preventing it from running into the garage. After 10 days of use, two of them were really waterlogged but continued as a barrier in stopping the water. Sure it will take a while for them to dry out, but I should able be to re-use if needed in the future. I would buy again if needed!
customer_reviews.author: resqdogs

customer_reviews.title: Terrific
customer_reviews.text: I am using this product in my firewood room. My bilco doors lead into this room and there is a leak around the base of the door. These socks act to block the draft extremely well, and they serve as a terrific method to slow the leakage. I don't want the leak to stop completely because the water empties into a floor drain. These socks are tremendous for slowing and controlling the runoff. They dry out on their own just sitting on the floor. I am very happy with this product and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: PPK

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy, cant use!
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a knockoff of the absorbent water snake I bought in 2016, which I love. The difference is: outer material is totally different, almost like burlap. The inner material feels like nut shells or wood chips, but the worst of it is the dust that comes out of it and when it gets wet, it leaks an awful reddish brown liquid even if the water it was absorbing is clean. I noticed my original purchase in 2016 was made in USA, these were made in China...figures! I sent them back....
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because I occasionally I get water in my basement. I thought they might help. To my unhappy surprise, I had a chance to use them sooner than expected. They worked a treat. I had been using towels to mop up, which meant a ton of laundry. These worked very well. I dried them out, and they are ready for my next emergency.
customer_reviews.author: beanbug

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t absorb like I had hoped for my situation.
customer_reviews.text: They do absorb water but seems to more redirect the water . Used them for water in basement. I purchased another type that worked very well thinner and more flexible. However, could not find again . Found these and did not absorb as much as I thought they would. I have an issue with basement getting water when in rains heavy.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2Boys

customer_reviews.title: FOR INDOOR USE ONLY, I GUESS
customer_reviews.text: Live in AZ and rain enters house from poor drainage. Purchased product 1-1/2 months ago. Placed one outside of door and the other inside. IT HAS NOT RAINED DURING THIS TIME. The inside one is fine, but the outside one deteriorates and falls apart (what a mess!). Used another brand (black ones) prior to this and had much greater success.
customer_reviews.author: H. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Contains Water Leakage
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for the first time at least 5 years ago to keep snow melt from my car from running across the garage and damaging my wall. They work beautifully for this purpose and it is taking this long for me to decide I need to replace the old ones. These new ones look the same and you get a lot of bang for your buck considering the longevity you get with them.
customer_reviews.author: Twitch

customer_reviews.title: Awesome absorbers that are reusable
customer_reviews.text: These “snake” like absorbers have done its job to stop the irritating people upstairs who constantly overflow their sink. I have not gotten so much water yet to have to dry it out yet. These are a lifesaver as well in my shed that had water leaking in from the storm that just passed. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Tricia M.

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: cant rate the features yet as i have them set up in my basement in case i get any leaks from a heavy rain. I haven't experienced any leaks yet but can say they seem good quality heavy duty easy to work with. i'm pretty certain they are going to work well when i need them to as i occasionally get a small amount of water in the basement and using these as a dike of sorts to contain the water to a small area should a leak occur.
customer_reviews.author: R. Benson

customer_reviews.title: Every home should have these
customer_reviews.text: If you own a home, you are going to have a flood at some point in time and you will not, I repeat, NOT have enough towels to contain it. These work great and absorb a lot or water. When you are done just leave them out in the sun, garage or wherever you have room from them to dry for the next time.
customer_reviews.author: k gannon

customer_reviews.title: Work well
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our windows that sweat in the winter with our gas fireplace. They fit fine in our large windows and I cut them down to custom fit in the rest. They seem to need a little moisture to get them started and then they work well after that. I have not tried to "dry them out" yet but will come back and update when we do.
customer_reviews.author: RWP

customer_reviews.title: They do what they are supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: We are using them in our basement to help with the ground water rising here in Eastern Iowa. When they get soaked, we put them in the washing machine on the drain and spin cycle. That takes out most of the water. We then put them on a drying rack next to the dehumidifier and let them dry out more. They do not stop the water completely, but they do soak up the lesser water. We bought some "dams" for stopping the water. This is a battle that I think we are not winning but not losing.
customer_reviews.author: JD in Iowa

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for around my cottage water pump bc when it gets hot the pump sweats & then I have a wet tile floor. Aggravating & dangerous! This works wonderfully. Soaks it up behind my cupboard, so no one sees it, and no more mess. A wonderful idea. Hopefully it won’t be needed for more serious leaks! lol
customer_reviews.author: vick

customer_reviews.title: Does an excellent job at soaking up water
customer_reviews.text: Does an excellent job at soaking up water. They do not take long to get completely filled up as you can imagine. I use it in my garage in the winter to soak up and water from the snow/ice left on the cars.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Very effective at absorbing water
customer_reviews.text: Whenever there are wind and heavy rain I get a couple of leaks in 2 of my windows. I just used them for the first time and they were very effective at absorbing the water. Nothing dripped out of the pigs. Now I have them drying in my balcony, to get them ready for the next heavy rain. I am extremely happy with them.
customer_reviews.author: Thinkerball

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Used at sliding doors during hurricane - worked great for water intrusion.
customer_reviews.author: CH NC

customer_reviews.title: Real Deal
customer_reviews.text: These work great. They're not fancy with kitten shaped heads on the end. They've light, absorbent workhorses. Deployed as soon as they arrived, and immediately mitigated some rainfall overflow at a set of bilco door stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Colgate

customer_reviews.title: Absorbing sock saved the day
customer_reviews.text: I saw this water absorbing sock at a local grocery store and got the idea that it would be good for parts of my basement that would seep water after heavy rains. Putting down towels was a bit much and this has been a better response. Works perfectly and I had extra and gave them to my neighbor as we both have the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: Small legal firm

customer_reviews.title: Soak it up
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to use around the snow dripping cars. Works great. I just change them out when soaked, let the wet ones dry and reuse. Appear fairly durable.
customer_reviews.author: chapter 11

customer_reviews.title: Does not stop seepage of water
customer_reviews.text: Easy to handle but not effective. For a small leak in the basement we went through 4 socks at a time. They do NOT dry easily. Takes days!! Once dry they do not absorb much. It runs under them. Will not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They do the job
customer_reviews.text: They really soak up the water that accumulates in our basement after a heavy rain. I've used the same ones for years now & they're pretty dirty & kinda float before they start absorbing so it's time to buy new ones. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Unusual use
customer_reviews.text: Strange 1975 house design has hot water tank in a closet located in the center of the house. These fit perfect around the base tray to absorb any possible overflow. Also perfect between Storm & interior door for air leaks. Hopefully I will never have to test the absorbency .. but I think it would work.
customer_reviews.author: Jed Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Bought the big box after our basement flooded. This week a downpour started flooding the basement again and these things saved my life. Had one against the door that prevented the water from over taking the basement. A few extras thrown down while we unclogged the drain and boom no damage done. Amazing product with a great price
customer_reviews.author: Megan Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. We have concrete sinking in the garage from snow and rain dripping from the cars. This not only absorbs the rain and snow, but also dries up between the storms. I am worrying much less about further damage.
customer_reviews.author: S Patterson

customer_reviews.title: MIGHT NOT DO THE JOB..AGAIN
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT BUY THESE THEY ARE ONLY GOOD UP TO 3 TIMES!! A few came apart at seams when wet otherwise they work great. A few weeks later and they worked again!! I also got a water alarm.
customer_reviews.author: Cupcakemom

customer_reviews.title: The PIG.
customer_reviews.text: I got this because of a rug I used to prevent water from coming into the garage under the door. I have so many I hope I do not have to use them all. We have not have rain in some time. So I replaced the rug because of the smell. Sprayed the concrete with some Smell Killer ( some what worked) placed the pig in two areas I was concerned about and now wait for rain. Hopefully it will never rain like it did but we will see.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin Barefield

customer_reviews.title: Mildew resistant absorbing roll
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to place in front of my front-load washer. The seal is worn and every time I was a load it leaks a little bit of water. Using a towel didn’t work because it would mildew. This works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Deb717

customer_reviews.title: Soaks up water fast
customer_reviews.text: Got this none too soon. Had to use it after only having it a few days for pump that failed. It soaked up the water really fast and am so happy we had it on hand. It dried out really well and can be reused. It will be used as a barrier just incase it happens again.
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: They look absorbent and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use these yet. They look very sturdy and absorbent. Of course they will be very easy to use, and what a great price. I will edit my review after use.
customer_reviews.author: Toni B.

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved
customer_reviews.text: Needed something to block seeping water in a sunroom that’s susceptible to wind blown rain. This was the perfect solution. They perform as described.
customer_reviews.author: F W Hough

customer_reviews.title: Great for keeping small amounts of water contained.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for my garage where we have an apartment above. There is duct work that was not Insulated so we get a lot of condensation that drips on the floor. These help keep the puddles contained until I can wrap the duct work.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Witt

customer_reviews.title: Great for what I need.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the basement dry, absorbs a good amount of liquid from a small leak in the foundation. No more puddles, no funky smell. I don't have to pick up the tubes, just let them dry on the concrete floor where they are.
customer_reviews.author: Oxoned

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Water comes into my basement when it rains hard and I haven't figured how to solve that problem. These soak up the water and keep it contained. The mildew resistant was the selling point. They're lite weight and easy to use. Slow drying but that isn't a problem.
customer_reviews.author: NCMartha

customer_reviews.title: Did not work
customer_reviews.text: The water didn’t stop it soaked but water still went pass the product.
customer_reviews.author: aishah

customer_reviews.title: Great for hurricane protection
customer_reviews.text: Used this to put in sliding door tracks in Florida to prepare for potential hurricanes. They fit perfectly and will do the job. They were recommended to me and I bought, I recommended to my neighbor and they bought!!
customer_reviews.author: pat stair

customer_reviews.title: They did the trick
customer_reviews.text: We put them in the tracks of our sliders during Hurricane Dorian and no water entered. We live right on the ocean and the sliders face north so we had heavy wind. They did take a week or so to dry out, but it was still well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda R.

customer_reviews.title: Very effective
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these in my basement (and could probably use more). The stone walls are partially below ground and every once in a while, after a downpour of rain or a big snowmelt, water comes seeping (and sometimes streaming) through. These snakes just soak it right up! Afterwards, I just hang them up to dry. They haven't been needed very often so far, so we'll see how long they last.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy B

customer_reviews.title: Did not work well for flooding
customer_reviews.text: It says for flooding but mine didn’t seem to work very well. I can see spill containment, but not flooding. I sent mine back
customer_reviews.author: zach

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: Item was just as described. It was a great deal! I use them around the car in the garage to keep rain and snow slush from running into my workshop area.
customer_reviews.author: ladybug58

customer_reviews.title: Great concept- poor performance. Cheap & falls apart
customer_reviews.text: These things take FOREVER to dry! They just don’t work very well! Great concept- poor real world performance!! Plus....don’t leave them out in the sun too long because the blue sock material tears, breaks and crumbles in your hand. All the black stuffing on the inside falls out and makes a giant mess! Save your money....use old towels!
customer_reviews.author: Steven G.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for keeping excess dishwasher water off your kitchen floor!
customer_reviews.text: I placed one on the counter at the edge where water comes rushing out of the sink port connected to the dishwasher as well as another one placed on the floor directly under the dishwasher. Once the load had begun to shunt water out rapidly, instead of flooding all over the floor, the “pigs” suck it up.. keeping the floor dry! They work great 👍
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: They work great!
customer_reviews.text: they work great. They are reusable. The only thing I did not know, is that when trying to soak up rain water, spilling onto my covered patio,I will need more of them for the many days of rain we have had this year!!! RAINING LOTS In Southern California - we needed it!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen G.

customer_reviews.title: GLAD I found them
customer_reviews.text: We used to put paper towel rolls on the floor to absorb water from our leaky freezer. After getting of sick of how fast the would have to toss the paper towel rolls I looked into these. GLAD I found them. These last a lot longer than and they don't look as bad. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: Good quality product works well for sealing door entrance when heavy rains leak underneath door craks id definitely buy this again
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Good!! Very long!!
customer_reviews.text: These are much larger than expected but will do the job. We are using these to help prevent basement flooding. No flooding to test so this is preventative.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: Absorbs and can re-use
customer_reviews.text: Great absorber when we had a hard rain and water in basement. Following another reviewer's advice, I put them in washer on drain and spin cycle and they came out completely dry, ready for re-use. Very convenient and dependable.
customer_reviews.author: Rocco

customer_reviews.title: A good product
customer_reviews.text: They do absorb water, we use them by the doors on our porch during heavy rain. They do not hold back all of the water but are quite helpful. We put them along the walls in our basement. They are worth having.
customer_reviews.author: chris f.

customer_reviews.title: Good size and thick!  They worked for me!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to keep my sewer from overflowing all over. I also used these to keep the water from getting on the floor in my basement. They are long and very absorbent. Much better than the small ones I had.
customer_reviews.author: Jet

customer_reviews.title: Quality as well as wind blockers
customer_reviews.text: Place 3 in the wide track of my triple sliders and they are substantial in blocking out the wind sound that comes through the small drain holes at bottom track, like a door draft would do.
customer_reviews.author: kal

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I thought I would try these to help absorb water leaking into my basement during times of down pouring rain. I’m not sure if I need to place more on the floor in the same area or switch to a different brand. My basement had water beyond where we placed them. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: wlthlla

customer_reviews.title: Excellent absorption!
customer_reviews.text: These were absolutely wonderful. I had a leak in the exterior door to my garage and every time it rained, I was mopping up water. I used these and they absorbed so completely - I did not have any water leaking into the garage. It tool a bit longer to dry, but they were saturated as they held so much of the water. I would not hesitate to buy them again, however it appears that they will last for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: Anne M

customer_reviews.title: Good Water Soaking and Drying Out Capability
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the performance of this sock, much better than a different vendor I first bought. It dries out faster and by purchasing 12 to a box, you can easily rotate depending on your needs. Good price as well, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: José J. Amador, Phd

customer_reviews.title: Really works!
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought my first home. The first week after I moved in it rained almost constantly. I was coming home to puddles in the basement. I put one of these in the corner where the water seemed to be coming in and I haven’t had any issues. I scattered the rest in the other corners for safe measure. I was skeptical that this would solve the problem but it really works as described.
customer_reviews.author: Alison C.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect damn
customer_reviews.text: I used these to create a damn when my water heater was leaking to prevent further damage in the my basement until I could get the water heater replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Michele Murray

customer_reviews.title: Helps Soak up Water
customer_reviews.text: Did the job they were intended for...they claim that they can be dried out and used again...I tried, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: These Pigs really work!
customer_reviews.text: These things are amazing! I get water under a basement door when there are heavy rains. These Pigs do a great job absorbing the water. They dry out and do not smell like mildew, pretty amazing. I bought four and I switch them out and let it dry and always keep one there.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann P.

customer_reviews.title: Just what i needed
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for that monsoon rain in the spring when you get that inevitable trickle of water in the basement.
customer_reviews.author: jerry

customer_reviews.title: Works well.
customer_reviews.text: We had a washing machine that would leak water and we didn't have the funds to replace it. These saved our walls from otherwise certain destruction .
customer_reviews.author: Michael vest

customer_reviews.title: For my garage
customer_reviews.text: Absorbs car runoff snow and water well, but remember, not a dam. Took another reviewers idea and ran the soaked ones through the washer spin cycle. Wow! That was a lot of water! They dried quickly after that and put back in use!
customer_reviews.author: PepperthePup

customer_reviews.title: Works and reusable
customer_reviews.text: My back patio floods when a hard rain comes, these help absorb it
customer_reviews.author: mmt

customer_reviews.title: does the job . . .
customer_reviews.text: I live in a flood plain and sometimes we have water issues . . . I used the pigs to line the inside of my garage doors and the problem was solved . . . good product, as advertised, does the job, would use this vendor again . . .
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbency
customer_reviews.text: They work really well to absorb water in basements. Real lifesavers.
customer_reviews.author: Buzz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent item! Works GREAT!!!
customer_reviews.text: No big flood thankfully. However, tested with little water and holds up great. Covers wide area also bottom of door and semi adjoining!
customer_reviews.author: TheMan

customer_reviews.title: Great absorbant
customer_reviews.text: We had a water leakage problem in our basement. I put these down when the hurricane rains came and only one got wet and it absorbed the water and I was able to wring it out and put back down. I am so pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Chaelotte

customer_reviews.title: This product works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I work in a mid production machine shop . We have had a machine with a coolant leak for about 6 months. Technician can't find or fix the leak manager has been using floor dry (Absolute nightmare to keep floor clean ) I bought pig sock wrap around machine . Has been dry for over a month no sign of saturation in any of the socks yet. Will highly recommend these for other shops.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 👍🏽
customer_reviews.text: Works get around my 125 gallon aquarium for times the filters overflow
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: They don’t absorb water
customer_reviews.text: I noticed they weren’t absorbing water like the other type I have. So I put one in a bucket of water for three days.I took it out of the bucket and saw the water (very little) run off the cover of the sock.You could not notice any difference in the amount of water left in the bucket. ABSORBTION 000000 It is like it has a water repelant on it. Sorry but I had to vent.
customer_reviews.author: MARION P.

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This is the best if you need something to put along a wall or anything. They are the best.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't aware that you are not supposed to wash or dry them, so i ruined them after a single use.
customer_reviews.text: The item was great until i ruined them by washing them. You guys really ought to include a printout of that says DO NOT WASH OR DRY
customer_reviews.author: Metal Invictus

customer_reviews.title: Great absorption
customer_reviews.text: These are great for absorbing any water issues you may have. The work really well and are quite thick!
customer_reviews.author: barbara j

customer_reviews.title: Worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Really soaked up the rainwater as intended but alas the rain coming into my garage overwhelmed the Pigs. They work great and are indeed reusable (but they do take a while to dry out).
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lentz

customer_reviews.title: Nice piggy!
customer_reviews.text: Works great, use to keep Walter running off the car from getting all over the garage
customer_reviews.author: lowrider06

customer_reviews.title: These seem well-made and a very good value compared to others
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because we got a little water in our basement after a large snowstorm followed by rain. These seem well-made and a very good value compared to others. Haven't actually had to use them yet, though.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B

customer_reviews.title: Must Have For Basements That Have Small Water Issues
customer_reviews.text: These work amazing in our laundry room. We gat small amount of water through wall in heavy storms and these work like a charm and are reusable! No longer have to worry about a little water reaching trim or drywall and warping anything.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Splittstoesser

customer_reviews.title: MORE THAN I EXPECTED
customer_reviews.text: THESE PIGS WERE HUGE THEY COVERED THE WHOLE DOOR SPACE. THESE BIG PIGS REPLACES SOME VERY LITTLE ONE I WAS USING LIKE THEM A LOT
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Work as stated
customer_reviews.text: Absorb pretty well. Takes a little longer to dry than I expected, but come back nicely after fully drying. Do not get a smell even if wet for 24 hrs.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Hopefully I never need these
customer_reviews.text: Very nice and lite, placed in unfinished side of my basement up against finished side. Hope if is just as a precaution
customer_reviews.author: Dmart

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase! Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent. I put these thru the spin cycle in the washer and then put them back. It rained for 5 days and zero water seeped thru these. I should have bought these years ago. My basement is now more useable! !
customer_reviews.author: RC&CC

customer_reviews.title: they made a big difference in containing water
customer_reviews.text: I get water under my garage door during the winter from ice/snow melting. I staggered these 3 rows deep inside the garage and they made a big difference in containing the water. Will use these again next year.
customer_reviews.author: JEFFREY VACHON

customer_reviews.title: Great to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: Great for cleaning up water leaks. Dries out quickly and doesn't smell.
customer_reviews.author: Jaclyn Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars ⭐️
customer_reviews.text: Excellent absorbing material but storing them back it’s not convenient
customer_reviews.author: MHG

product_meta.title: Pack of 4 New Pig Mildew-Resistant Absorbent Socks | Water Absorbing Snake | Each 3" x 4' Sock Absorbs Up to 1 Gal | PIG106,Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Size:3" x 4'| Style:4-PackSOAK UP YOUR WATER PROBLEMS FAST! Taking care of the leaks, drips and spills in your home is tough work. At New Pig, we eat, sleep and breathe watery messes.
feature_bullets: MEET NEW PIG’S REUSABLE, MILDEW-RESISTANT, WATER-ABSORBING SOCK: Brought to you by the leaders in managing leaks, drips, and spills – these water absorbing snakes soak up water leaks, spills and condensation and are ideal when you need longer-term, water control
DESIGNED TO KEEP YOUR HOME DRY AND PROTECTED: Perfect for basement and garage leaks or anywhere water seeps in, lightweight, water-absorbing sock is designed to quickly absorb and retain water

MILDEW-RESISTANT AND REUSABLE FOR LONGER-TERM WATER CONTROL: Absorbent sock is ideal for soaking up water, air drying and reusing! Water absorber is made of 100% polypropylene skin and filler to resist the growth of mold and mildew — after use, hang it up, let it air dry and put it back to work

LIGHTWEIGHT AND FLEXIBLE: Stop water in its tracks! Shape this flexible sock to surround water pools and leaks to stop water from spreading – or, place them in front of freezers, coolers and more to catch leaks and condensation where they show up! Water absorbing snakes are designed to quickly absorb and retain water
EASY TO STORE: This 4-Pack comes in small, dispenser box that is easy to store and economical when you don’t need a whole box of socks
